results.title: Insect foods
results.creator_credit: Pat Dowling and Pat Dowling Pictures
results.brief_description: The purpose of this film is to show what and how insects eat, and to illustrate how the feeding habits of insects affect man. Shows clearly the feeding habits of certain insects. Could stimulate further discussion and interest and may kindle the enthusiasm of young people to aim at a career in entomology.
results.description: The purpose of this film is to show what and how insects eat, and to illustrate how the feeding habits of insects affect man. Shows clearly the feeding habits of certain insects. results.title: Insect collecting
results.creator_credit: Pat Dowling and Pat Dowling Pictures
results.brief_description: How an insect collection can be established. Representative terrestial and aquatic insects are studied in extreme close-up photography, collecting methods shown include netting, beating host plants, night collecting, investigating dead trees, using the Beriese funnel to procure microscopic speciments, and aquatic methods.

results.title: An Introduction to feedback
results.creator_credit: Charles Eames, Ray Eames and IBM
results.brief_description: A simple presentation of the feedback idea, its growing importance in technology and the use of the data processor for continuous measurement, evaluation and correction in, for example, the petroleum industry and traffic control. Like most of the films by Ray and Charles Eames, this is not traditional in content or approach. Music by Elmer Bernstein.

results.title: The Inquisitive giant
results.brief_description: Introduces a study of radio astronomy with a brief survey of the development of the optical telescope, from the early instruments of Galileo, Newton and Hershell to the giant modern telescopes of Mt Wilson and Palomar. Shows work in radio astronomy in many lands, focussing on British work. Shows the design and building of the steerable radio telescope at Jodrell Bank. Shots of the nebula of Andromeda, and of the Sun during eclipse, views of the giant but delicate instruments, show the magnitude of subject matter and tools in astronomy.

results.title: Innocent strangers
results.creator_credit: Jose Quijano, Joe O'Brien and United Nations Television
results.brief_description: A short television film featuring refugee stories from various parts of the world including the plight of 1,000,000 in Palestine. The film was originally produced by the United Nations Office of Public Information World Refugee Year. Narrated by Ralph Bellamy.

results.title: The Innocent eye
results.creator_credit: John Schlesinger, Peter Newington and BBC-TV
results.brief_description: Studies the imagination of young children as disclosed in their art. Children paint their own experiences; trains, family occasions, TV serials, country holidays.

results.title: The Inner man steps out
results.creator_credit: Robert Wilmot, Henry Strauss and Pathescope Company of America
results.brief_description: A supervisor who knows the “book rules” for human relations finds himself in trouble when trying to apply them to people on the job. Points out the things a man with supervisory responsibility needs to know about the way different people react to different situations, and the use he can make of this knowledge to improve his own job function and that of the people he supervises.

results.title: Injection errors
results.brief_description: Expresses some of the mistakes which can be made in giving injections and outlines simple steps which can prevent them. In particular, the route, size and frequency of injections must be planned and allergy, infection and drug interaction considered.
